newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Yield rises on Bulgaria 12-mth floater T-bills.
newsitem.headline: Yield rises on Bulgaria 12-mth floater T-bills.

text.p: The yield rose at Monday's auction of Bulgaria's Finance Ministry 12-month floating interest T-bills as a rise in the central bank main interest rate went into force, central bank figures showed.
The average yield to maturity on the issue was 54.49 percent, up from 49.90 percent at the respective auction on May 26.
The issue was offered with a par of five billion levs and no minimum acceptable price set in advance.
Interest on the paper is due at maturity. It equals the central bank main interest rate and is adjusted every time the rate is changed.
An increase in the central bank main interest rate to 48.72 percent annually from 43.08 percent became effective on Monday.
Details of the issue follow. Price in percent of par:
